description: Ahmed to Tharanga, OUT, bowled'm! looks to drive across the line and gets beaten by a long way
Baisya to Tharanga, OUT (Bowled)
surprise bouncer, Tharanga goes after it and the ball files off the edge, Agarkar at fine leg makes no mistake

Oram to Tharanga, OUT, another one goes! good length delivery outside the off stump and swinging away, litte bounce too, Tharang moves back and defends it, thin edge and keeper took the catch, batsman surpraised by the bounce
Franklin to Tharanga, OUT (Caught), good ball, bit more bounce, Tharanga drives off the back-foot, gets a thin edge, McCullum takes the catch
Martin to Tharanga, OUT (Caught)
Lee to Tharanga, OUT, Got'em! perfect inswinging yorker on the off stump, Thranga defends it on the front foot, beaten and ball crashes into the stumps
Kruger to Tharanga, OUT, short and wide outside the off stump, Thranga went for expensive drive, thick edge and ball went to wide of Boucher, he took the splendid catch

Mashrafe Mortaza to Tharanga, OUT: GONE! first strike for        Bangladesh, good ball short of length on the stumps, goes back        with an open face, gets an edge to second slip, where Nafees takes        the catch low down.

GONE! first wicket for Pakistan, Razzaq strikes, good length delivery pitched outside off stump and moves away, Tharanga drives, gets an edge, this time Akamal dives to his left and takes a good catch in front of the first slip.

short ball, pitched outside the off stump and cutting in, Tharanga goes for the pull and once fails to connect properly, ball clips the top-edge and lobs up towards midwicket, easy catch held and a massive innings come to an end

finally Harmison gets what he deserves. Tharanga had been pinned down by good bowling and tight fielding and pushed onto the back foot, and Harmison pitched one slightly fuller which he edged low to Marcus Trescothick at first slip who took a fairly comfortable two-handed catch.
Dalrymple strikes, a much needed wicket, the wicket of Tharanga, who sweeps, gets the top edge to short fine leg, Strauss moves across and takes the catch.
Tharanga gives himself room and takes a few steps on the charge, only to find Solanki at extra-cover who takes a straightforward catch. A badly needed breakthrough for England.

Atlast a wicket! flighted ball on the middle and leg stump line, Tharanga moves forward and tries to on-drive, ball takes off the leading edge and goes straight back to the bowler, end of an amazing record-breaking partnership!

cleaned up at the death! Mortaza finally gets his slower ball correct, lands on a good length on off, Tharanga has a weary slog across the line, misses, and loses his middle stump, well bowled but what a fine effort from Tharanga

goes for a big swing through the leg side, but he was getting tired and missed the ball by a fair distance as it crashes into the stumps. The end of another fine innings from the left-hander who has built a platform from which the rest of the Sri Lankan batsmen can really have a dip in the closing overs.&

Tharanga goes first ball! Full outside off stump and Tharanga played a nothing shot really. He didn't move his feet at all and just chopped down half-heartedly at it, the ball took the bottom edge and crashed into his stumps
gone! Fullish again outside off stump, again Tharanga tries that booming drive but gets a thick outside edge which Akmal gladly snaps up, Razzaq strikes after going for runs

well bowled! Lovely bit of bowling giving it plenty of flight, dragging the batsman down the pitch, the ball spitting away from him and McCullum whips off the bails with ease. Super ball, that. Super innings too.

yes, gone! Short of a good length on middle and leg, rears from where it lands and angles across Tharanga, squares him up outside off stump and forces him to fish, and he gets a simple edge through to Boucher, great delivery from Ntini

oh ho, another wicket! That was a good, quick delivery, tight outside off stump, and Tharanga just stands there and plays at it, getting an outside edge that a gleeful McCullum accepts, thats two in two balls

gone this time! He pushes in one on a good length outside off stump, the corridor of uncertainty, as they say, and Tharanga plays away from the body looking for the cut, and the result is a thick edge into the lap of Ross Taylor at first slip! Mason has his revenge!

What a acrobatic catch by McCullum! New Zealand are right on top here. IT was banged in short, down the legside, Tharanga goes for a pull and the ball runs off the face of the bat and it could well have been a four if not for McCullum. He flung himself to his right, like a goalkeeper, to pull off a stunner. Super catch that. And Sri Lanka slip into further trouble.

Gillespie is on fire. Another strike! Full in length, on the middle stump line, held its line, Tharanga is late in leaning forward, just pushes down the wrong line, the ball thuds into the thigh pad and knocks back the furniture.

he's dragged it back and the Eden Gardens erupt! That wasn't short enough to pull and Tharanga tried to force it through midwicket from outside off stump, he got a thick inside edge that cannoned into off stump
now Sreesanth strikes! pitched up slightly outside the off stump, Tharanga loses his concentration, pokes at it and the ball carries to Tendulkar at first slip at a comfortable height

two in the over! This one lands on a back of a length outside off stump and swings in alot, Tharanga is rooted and late on the shot, the ball hits him on the pad and looked to be hitting leg stump, and the umpire shoots up the dreaded finger, looked very close, as the replays suggest

and he strikes, Hurdle! This one is angled down leg stump off a shorter length, then it bounces and moves off the seam, and Tharanga just manages to tickle it into the gloves of a diving Minors behind the stumps!

superb catch by Aftab at backward point! Rafique drops in a rank short ball outside off stump, Tharanga punches off the back foot but fails to keep it down, and Aftab times his jump to perfection, plucking it in the air with his right hand, losing control, but then bobbing it up and taking in cleanly as he falls to the ground

Tendulkar takes out the well-set Tharanga. Full in length, lands on the middle stump line and shapes down. Tharanga is walking all over the crease and tries to dab it to the on side, fails and is hit in front of leg and middle. Would have hit leg.  Tendulkar is getting some movement there. In the previous over, it was in the air and now, it is off the track.

Ntini nails Tharanga with one of his specials : a length-delivery that angles away from the left-hand batsman. Tharanga pushes at it, bat away from the body, and edges it low to Kemp at first slip who pouches it safely.

he's gone! An early strike! There was just a little bit of movement and the batsman plays all around it, two stumps being knocked out of the ground in the process. Well, Powell deserved that one - he's been asking the questions and finally he has his answer
banged in outside and that's a mistimed pull sliced up to Pietersen, who makes a Powerplay-esque sign with his whirly arms in delight

What a stunner from Bond. At third man. It was short and outside off, Tharanga gave it the full treatment. It screamed towards Bond, who was a few yards inside the rope. He back-pedals and dives backward to take the catch.

edged and gone! Set him up with a couple inswingers, this time he fires it full and gets it to seam away as Tharanga pushes forward, and the edge is snapped up by Hayden at first slip, taking it very low even as Ponting from second dives in front of him!
short, cut to gully off the back foot and that's a very tidy catch indeed!

Around his legs! Cleaned him up. Vettori fires it quick and flat and on middle and leg. Tharanga chooses the wrong shot, trying to sweep past short fine, and goes way across his stumps, exposing the middle and leg. The ball is too quick for him and goes around his pads to rattle middle. Huge wicket, Dan the Man strikes

That's more swing, and that's all over. Short of a length and Tharanga doesn't know whether to go forward or back. Stands rooted to the crease and simply pushes his bat limply, the edge is taken and Gilchrist snaps up a regulation catch behind the stumps. That's the first wicket for Australia and it was all to do with the length. Bracken strikes.
Tharanga falls, two short of a fifty, sweeping one on leg stump, with a thick top-edge, to Nazir at short fine leg

Anjum is on fire. Teasing line, full and outside off, moving away off the seam and Tharanga is sucked into drive, on the up, but ends up nicking it behind. Big wicket. Tharanga looked in complete command there.

Another stunner from the Africans. This time it is AB de Villiers. Short and outside off, Tharanga carves it to left of de Villiers. at point,  who takes a step and goes airborne and watches the ball sail into his cupped palms.

caught! Reza angles the ball into Tharanga from round the wicket and moves it away from the left-hander off the pitch, Tharanga moves forward and drives loosely at it and gets a thick edge to Mushfiqur who takes the simplest of catches
Gone! Shahadat gets his revenge. It hit the deck short of length and climbed above waist-high as it slanted across Tharanga who was squared-up a touch and had a fatal poke.
England strike early! Just outside off, a thick edge and Cook takes a tumbling catch to his left at second slip
straight, Tharanga once more plays down the wrong line with not much foot movement, the ball finds a big gap between bat and pad and pins back the off stump
gone! Reward for Sidebottom's excellent control this morning as he finds another away-swinger which leaves Tharanga at the very last moment, handing first slip a comfortable catch at waist height

edged and taken! Bracken strikes, pitching on a full length outside off stump and sucking Tharanga into a very loose drive from the crease, the late swing does the trick and Gilchrist takes the easiest of catches
pitches outside off and moves away, Tharanga stays rooted to the crease and goes for the drive through the covers, he only manages a thick inside edge which shaves his offstump
Short, wide, slashed to wide third man. Tharanga's laborious effort comes to an end. He sliced it to left of Taylor who held on to it. Bravo punches his fist in delight.
gone! that was short of a good length on the off and moving away, Tharanga tries to defend it off the back foot, gets the thinnest of edges to Taibu who takes a comfortable catch
Mortaza strikes! He gets lovely inswing in to the left hander and lands it on a full length, he shuffles to work it across to the on side, exposes his legstump and he's trapped in front

Tharanga loses his patience and gives it all away, Nazmul sprays it wide outside off and tempts the batsman to have a wild swing at it, he stays rooted to the crease and gets a thick outside edge to the keeper, the crowd has gone wild and why not
finally Tharanga's troubled stay comes to an end, he had played and missed many times already and this time he gets the edge, a length ball just outside off, a thin edge through to the keeper

Aamer lands it on a good length outside off and gets it to angle inwards, Tharanga is forced onto the shot but the ball skids through and takes the thick outside edge, Jamshed takes it comfortably at first slip
that could be the end of Sri Lanka's chances, another batsman poking outside off only to nick it to the keeper, a fairly innocuous delivery which Tharanga feathers through to Akmal

first blood to Aamer and Pakistan get rid of the top scorer from the previous game, Aamer lands it on a good length outside off and gets it to come in with the angle, the ball gets high on Tharanga who pokes his bat out and gives Umar Akmal catching practice at second slip

Raina strikes, good stumping. Tharanga comes down the track again, Raina fires it in, the ball deflects off Tharanga's pads, goes one bounce and way down the leg side to Dhoni, but Tharanga is way out himself

Harbhajan strikes. He lures Tharanga forward with a flighted delivery on a good length, from round the stumps; it dips and turns away from Tharanga who was looking to tap it across the line. Sehwag lunges to his right at slip to take a neat catch

bowled em! Well done Jadeja, tosses it up on a length outside off stump, Tharanga drives at the ball against the spin with a massive gap between bat and pad, the ball pitches and turns in a long, long way and hits off stump
gone first ball! Zaheer doesn't allow much room, just bowls it full and straight, Tharanga chases it with a big swing and no footwork and inside-edges it back onto his stumps
bowled em! What a terrific start for Zaheer, who pitches the ball up to Tharanga and seams the ball back in from around outside off stump, beats a loose forward push, and clips the top of middle
Bangladesh get their first wicket, it's angled across Tharanga who goes for the big lofted shot, and is done in by the angle, getting an outside edge through to the keeper
soft dismissal, is looking to drive, the ball doesn't turn much and he checks his shot and lobs back a simple catch to Harbhajan
edged and taken! Tyagi sends down the same delivery that angles across the stumps but instead of leaving it Tharanga goes for a drive without much footwork and edges straight into first slip's lap

edged and gone! Kohli takes a nice catch at second slip. Slight hint of movement away, from back of a length, and he slashes at it without any feet movement, and Kohli gobbles it up overhead. Second straight duck for Tharanga
against the run of play, edges this, just hangs his bat in a nothing shot, and the fullish delivery turns away taking the edge low towards slip where Kohli takes a smart catch

Shoaib smiles. He spreads his arms. He doesn't run to nowhere like he used to do. Just stands there and walks towards his team-mates. Times they are changing. It was a short delivery outside off and Tharanga went for the cut but edged it to first slip.

More to cheer for Bangladeshi supporters as Tharanga is stumped. This is angling down the leg side, and he looks to play it fine of fine leg and makes too fine a contact and Mushfiqur is quick to get down the leg side and take the catch. Instinctively he takes a step down the wicket, and Mushfiqur is quick with the stumping, just in case. I remember them taking at least one couple each over with this shot, and here it has got his wicket

Zaheer roars having finally got rid of Tharanga after having troubled him for a while. Short of a length outside off, nothing special about that ball, but that's like saying there was nothing special about Glenn McGrath. Tharanga again pokes uncertainly, and inevitably he's edged one. Dhoni does the rest.

Oh boy! what has he done! He shoulders arms to a delivery that cuts back in from outside off to take out the off stump! As they say in gully cricket, a very bad "well left" Not! He has been at the other end and has been watching Zaheer cut the ball in a great deal while bowling to Sanga but he decides to shoulder arms. This one pitched just outside off and tilted in. Clatter!
Caught at deep cover. It was the slower one, fullish outside off, and he ended up chipping it to Watling in the deep. Fine knock, though. He has done his job.

Clatter! What a dramatic start! Upul Tharanga has lost his off stump. It was full in length, landed around the middle  and off, and moved towards the off stump. Tharanga was caught at the crease, neither forward nor back, and pushed out at it.  He lunged out at it in the last moment and ended up stumbling out of his crease. The ball moved past the desperate waft and crashed into the off stump. Timber! The bails fly! PK jumps for joy.
Done in by the bouncer. Tharanga was late on the pull and ended up lobbing it to short fine-leg. Dolly of a catch. Tuffey breaks into a smile.
But he is gone now! Yuvraj strikes. It landed outside the off stump and straigthened, Tharanga went for the cut shot again but edged this one!

Watson makes the breakthrough! He's swung it in to Tharanga, who pushed forward without much intent, the ball struck him in line and Erasmus says that's out. Pitched in line, straightened well and the only question was height, but it looked good at first glance.
now this is against the run of play! Tharanga looks to defend the ball and gets an inside edge that trickles back onto the stumps and dislodges the bails

well, I take that back. Hafeez has nailed Tharanga. As mentioned earlier, there is an army of green shirts inside the circle on the off side. Tossed up outside on leg, Tharanga drives on the up, and picks out Afridi at mid-off. He's thrilled after pouching the catch, tumbling forward. The game is back in the balance after Sri Lanka's recovery of sorts.

what a take! Tharanga cannot believe it, it was that short and wide delivery that he likes to take toll of, but it bounced a shade too much for his comfort, tand he cut it in the air past point, or thought he had, but Steve Smith there pulled off a stunner, timing his leap at full stretch to perfection, taking it one handed, he juggled with it somewhat before taking it cleanly in the end, that ball was really traveling like a bullet, if not a 'tracer' bullet

falls just short of the world record for the highest opening partnership of 286, came down the track for another lofted one over extra cover, for once, it did not come off cleanly, went high in the air more than anything else, and was taken cleanly way inside the boundary, do Zimbabwe have some respite? Not

Ryder take a bow! Even fat men can fly says George Binoy! This Kiwi sure can fly. Was that Jesse Ryder or Jesse Owens? Here's what happened - it was a short ball outside off, enough width and room for Tharanga in his current form to flay at. Enough room for him to try and go aerial. Ryder was lurking at point. He moved quickly to his left, took off with as much grace as he is capable of and landed with a resounding thud. In the meantime, he caught the ball. And then he stood up with arms aloft, menacing beard and frown in place, like a WWE superstar. What a moment!

caught at slip! And Zaheer hasn't conceded a run yet. Zaheer pitches the ball on a length around off, forcing Tharanga to prod because of his line as well as the pressure he's created, the ball nips away from the left-hander off the pitch and Tharanga edges it. The chance flies quickly to Sehwag's right at first slip and he takes it before falling to the ground
Doherty strikes, Tharanga went back as he saw a marginally shortish one, it turned in sharply and beat his attempted cut to hit off stump, he was looking really good, Doherty is pumped up

Johnson strikes. His red-hot form continues. Digs this one in short, outside off, Tharanga looks to sway out of the line, but doesn't quite take the gloves out of the way. The ball doesn't quite rise up, and kisses the glove on the way

Irony once again. Tharanga has edged so many times today, he has played and missed so many times today. He falls to Bollinger, who caused him most of the problems today, but it is not an edge! Short of a length ball on off stump, Tharanga tries to back away and guide it to third man, and ends up steering it straight into Haddin's gloves. Straight off the face of the blade. Good innings, but Tharanga will be the first to admit he's played much better than this several times.

Lee has gone through Tharanga, pretty ordinary shot and the stumps are splattered, it was the slower one from Lee, 125.3 kph, full and on the stumps, Tharanga just had a huge heave at it, and played all over it
Tharanga is gone, Johnson strikes in the first over, short of length ball outside off, Tharanga fishes at it, a thin edge through to the keeper

Tharanga's efforts at improvisation fail him eventually, tossed up and he was looking to clear mid-on this time, tossed up and he struck it loosely straight to the fielder positioned there. Cheema took a straightforward catch
caught at wide long-on! Afridi's struck. Tharanga tried to launch the ball over the midwicket boundary but mis-timed it, Younis Khan settled under a simple catch

what a response! The off stump is flattened! I'm not sure Tharanga actually saw that because it appeared to skid off the pitch, he was rooted to the crease, the ball landed on a good length, held its line and hit the top of the off stump, landed a yard or two back. This is Gul's first wicket in the one-day series

and gone. Tanvir has bowled a few huge inswingers and now slips in the away-swinger. When he's on song, he gets these to snake about madly. Tharanga didn't spot the movement, he got the front foot out and looked to defend to the off side, but the deviation was too much. The feather carries into Umar's gloves and Tharanga walks.

Tharanga bags a duck! South Africa have struck early. Angled across this time, there was enough room for a punch through point, but Tharanga didn't move the feet at all. He through his hands at it, and it skimmed off the outside edge and was dying on Duminy at gully, who tumbled forward and held brilliantly.

ah, tragic for SL. Just as he was looking super-ominous, Tharanga is gone. Short of a length and angled across, not too much pace, no sideways movement. Not much room to work with. Tharanga did what he's done efficiently all day - he attempted to make some room and steer with an open-face to third man, but this time he edges it into AB's gloves. Well played, given the circumstances, but he'll hurt on the way back in.
eep, Sri Lanka have lost a wicket out of nowhere, just like that, it was becoming too easy for them, Tharanga went for a casual sweep, and the top edge is taken easily by short fine leg

an early breakthrough for South Africa, Tharanga falls as he looks to slice the ball through the off side, some bounce for Tsotsobe, the top edge, and a simple catch for AB de Villiers, two half-centuries and two failures for Tharanga this series

sensational catch from Duminy, Tharanga was looking in great touch here, he's gone for 46 though, Tsotsobe sends in the slower one, Tharanga looks to slice that, off a thick outside edge, the ball swirls over cover, Duminy runs with his back towards the pitch, and then dives forward to pluck the ball even as it fell over his shoulder, South Africa needed something special to end that opening stand

this was coming, Zaheer has toyed with Tharanga, who was getting nowhere against all that movement, he tried advancing down the track to take on Zaheer, but played a half-hearted weak push at one that left him to loop to Sachin at first slip

that has been helped straight to Clarke at first slip, Starc strikes early, good delivery, angled in on a good length on off, moving away appreciably, Tharanga is caught on the crease and dabs it high to first slip

beauty from Vinay, Tharanga's troubles in Australia continue, a short of length ball that moves away a touch, Tharanga doesn't bother much about his footwork as he fishes at the ball, nicks it and it's easy for Dhoni, who has to move forward a touch to collect that

Tharanga goes! Is that the decisive blow? Pitched on a length and he had to go for it, strikes it well but not enough in it to take it over the ropes, David Hussey at long-on holds his nerve and takes a comfortable catch
big relief for Australia! Angles it close to the off stump and Tharanga tries to drive and gets a thick outside edge and Wade takes the catch low, the captain himself gets the vital breakthrough
another wicket for Irfan, Tharanga goes for the drive but Irfan gets it to move in tad on a fullish length, resulting in Tharanga getting an inside edge onto the stumps,

Ajmal has gone through Tharanga, and then taken off on a run, the doosra, bowled with superb control, tossed up around off, draws Tharanga forward, he leaves a gap between bat and pad as he plays down the original line, the ball turns in a tad to go through the gate and rattle the stumps
important strike, Tharanga goes caught behind, to a full away swinging delivery just outside off, Tharanga bent across, tried to run it away but only managed a thick edge to Rahim
Tharanga has missed this by a country mile. Charges at Hafeez, who bowls full and straight. Tharanga swings around the off-stump line, and this takes out the middle stump
Tanvir strikes. This is a length ball, outside off, lands on the upright seam, holds its line, and takes the edge of the pushing bat. Tharanga walks

a sharp slip catch by Younis. Loose shot from Tharanga. Short of a length, outside off, holding the line a bit if anything, and Tharanga drives at it without any foot movement. It's a healthy edge to the left of second slip, and YK is alert there

How do you play these? Too good from Tanvir. Slightly slower, 126ks, short of a length, on off, Tharanga plays for the angle, but the ball holds its line, squares him up, beats the edge, and hits the off stump. Cartwheeling goes the off stump

short and wide and after four dot balls, Tharanga looks for a release off a short delivery with some width, tries to slash it through point, gets a thick edge and it ricocheted off Dhoni's glove towards first slip

that confident shot off the previous ball doesn't do Tharanga much good, one again he chases a wide one, it was moving away as well, Tharanga had to reach out for that one, this time he edges, through to Dhoni, not much footwork from Tharanga there, Zaheer has his second

Tharanga is stumped, Ashwin saw Tharanga skipping down the track, bowled it short, the ball didn't turn away after pitching, carried on in the same direction, Tharanga was looking for the spin and he misses the ball, he yards out of the crease, Dhoni has the ball, bails on the ground and both of Sri Lanka's openers are now dismissed
ohh Tharanga goes, he was looking really good, Irfan strikes again, pitched up outside off and he drives it loosely and straight to extra cover, easy catch

soft dismissal! The previous ball was pulled for four and Tharanga tried to repeat that, it was short and he swished too early and got a bottom edge to the keeper, Mills was millimeters away from overstepping
and he's gone now, what an over, Southee hurrying him again with another short ball, he tries to back away and hook at the same time, the effort lands in fine leg's hands

short of length, and Tharanga, who played that lovely shot last ball, tries to repeat it, but plays it in the air straight to Rob Nicol's hands at point. He was finally looking settled but has been taken down by Southee again.

Southee picks up his third wicket, Tharanga goes just as the rain comes down, short of a length and he was trying to repeat that shot though trying to get it more past point, got an edge and Watling dived full length to his right and took it one-handed, good take and Sri Lanka are in danger of getting bowled out soon here
Tharanga goes! Starc just put it in the right spot, no noticeable movement and Tharanga pushes at it outside off and a thick edge through to Haddin
Australia have struck in no time, pitched up outside off and Tharanga drives it through the line, or tries to, just a hint of away movement, gets a thin edge and Haddin snaps it easily

....and Australia sneak in another! Strac bowls this full and wide and across the left-hander, Tharanga pushes at it away from the body, thick outside edge to Clarke who falls low to his left at first slip

there comes the first wicket! It was a short of length delivery angling across the left hander, Tharanga chooses to throw his bat at that without moving his feet and pays the price as he gets a feather on that one. It settles in keeper's gloves at a nice comfortable height
good catch from li'l Bravo. Charles sighs in relief. Full and wide, Tharanga drives, fails to keep it down, and Bravo lunges to his right to claim this at cover. Holder is pumped

Bhuvneshwar strikes in his first spell again. It is incredible how many times he does that. Short of a length, just outside off, Tharanga follows it a little lazily. The ball gets a good lift, takes the edge, and Raina at second slip is wider than usual. And you know what, the ball has found Raina as if it were the bull's eye

this one will carry alright, and the angle has worked for Bhuvi, the last one held its line, this one comes in from short of a length and bounces, Tharanga leans out half forward, is completely cramped by the angle and Dhoni takes the inside edge
Tharanga's edged one too many this time, Morkel's bowled a good length ball from round the stumps, Tharanga was looking to guide it, and has instead played on off an inside edge

a spectacular catch gets the first wicket, a short ball from Morkel, Tharanga is hurried into the pull, doesn't time the ball at all, it loops towards midwicket where Peterson runs back and dives to send back Tharanga for another low score

Morkel is softening them up and Tsotsobe is reaping the rewards with some tight bowling too. Short of a length outside off, the ball bounces sharply, shapes away from the left-hander and hits the outside edge as Tharanga prods from his crease. Petersen takes the catch at first slip at head height
and a breathrough, pushes at a widish one with not a lot of confidence and a this edge is found, he walks as Thompson celebrates

nicks off! Pakistan have their first second and Tharanga's strength ends up a weakness again. He was completely squared up by a shade of movement to a back of a length delivery. His legs were splayed down the leg side and his hands offered a loose poke outside off. Akmal behind the stumps takes a neat catch

lovely delivery, and once again Wahab gets Tharanga to poke at it outside off, no footwork. It shaped away, and he's stuck in his crease, moving neither forward, back, nor across, and gets an outside edge through to the keeper

leans into a cover drive, only he ends up inside edging onto middle stump! Invitingly full, even if that doesn't seem Irfan's natural length, it was wide enough to chase but the batsmen mistimed it. Good way to go to the break for Pakistan
straight to long-on for a simple catch! It was pitched up on middle and leg and Tharanga chipped it down the ground against the turn for a high and easy catch to Dhawan. SL three down now

Faulkner strikes right away for his captain as Tharanga, Sri Lanka's last recognised batsman, has to go after carting this back of a length straight to the man stationed at cow corner, who is able to get under it quite comfortably

too good. He is just too good against the left-handers. Angles the good length ball in to force a shot. Tharanga flails at it after lunging outside his crease. The turn is too much, the outside edge is comprehensively beaten. Sarfraz takes care of the rest. Beaten in flight.

gone right through to knock the off stump! Movement off the pitch for Rahat as the ball pitched outside off, came in with the angle too as Tharanga didn't move his feet at all and let the ball go through the gap between bad and pad. Rahat pumps his fist
its an outside edge which pops up to Anderson at short third man. Chandimal charged down the other end to make sure he is on strike.

full and wide, Tharanga chases it and nicks off! His strange return down the order continues to baffle, the ball was a bit too far away from him to drive and he only succeeded in squeezing an edge through to the keeper
bowled him! Line and length, nipping off the deck, trimming the bails on the top of middle stump and Thranga has a wipe across the line and connects with thin air!

tossed up, pitches on the crease as Tharanga drives loosely, and his off stump pops out of the ground with a hugely satisfying "splut"! A first-baller, and now the welsh soprano is beginning to warble

what a soft dismissal! Tharanga will cringe looking at that dismissal for a long time. It was a short ball and Tharanga looks for a pull shot but the ball stops on him and he goes through with the shot early as a result. Gets a leading edge that lobs up towards the bowler and Nurse takes it easily. And that's the end of Tharanga's pained stay
short ball, no pace again, just 116kph and Tharanga gets a top-edge on the pull as the ball stops on him. He lobs it to square leg where Ashley Nurse runs back a few steps before snaffling it

Catch him if you can. Tahir sets off on a typical celebratory sprint. Tahir hangs it up outside off, Tharanga presses forward, carelessly drives the ball in the air.... Head-high catch for Duminy at cover. Tahir is slicing through the SL middle order

length ball, Tharanga tries to go over the top, clears mid-off... OR NOT!!! De Villiers takes another brilliant catch, this time running back and pocketing the ball cleanly as it dropped over his shoulder! SA have two, Parnell has two, Faf and AB a blinder apiece. Both SL openers now back in the hutch
bouncer at a middle stump line, Tharanga takes it on but it's a top edge and it flies straight to Pretorius at fine leg. South Africa will be pleased - Duminy certainly looks it

huge moment in the match. Is that a game-changer? Tharanga's exhibition is over and it will be very sad if it were to end in a losing cause. Newlands faithful applaud, Tahir runs up to him to shake his hand. The Sri Lankans in the dressing room applaud. What a moment. Coming back, this was short and wide outside off, Tharanga could have had a real go at that one if he liked, but he somehow just held back a touch and ended up steering it straight to backward point.

angled across in the channel, Tharanga's bottom hand comes off the bat as he slices a drive... and it sails down the gullet of third man! First blood to SA, Morris celebrates without emotion. The Cape Town centurion falls

chipped tamely to mid-on. That is a desperate shot and there is stunned silence at the ground. Short ball, looking to pull and there is no room absolutely. Does not find the middle of the bat and gets big on him as well. Ahat is the simplest of catches to the Bangladesh captain, off the splice of the bat

goes straight through! Tharanga falls. Fullish delivery around leg, Tharanga is beaten for pace as he plays around the delivery. The ball sneaks through bat and pad and hits middle stump. Another good delivery by Taskin, nice upright seam.

is that the game for South Africa? Tharanga has hit this straight to Miller at deep cover. He read the googly, got to the pitch of the ball to go over the infield. It was almost as if he forgot there was a man there. Miller was running in with the sun right in his eyeline but he did well to keep his balance

inside-edge and bowled him! He tries one more slog onto the leg side but it's full and wide outside off, he plays that away from his body and the ball finds the inside-edge of his bat. Crashes into the base of middle stump and Tharanga has to go. He was just finding his rhythm

goodness, what a delivery! That's a beauty from Raza. It's a dream delivery for an offspinner. Loops up a length ball that pitches on middle and draws Tharanga forward. Rips past the outside edge and so sharp is the turn that it only takes out the outside part of off-stump. In-form batsman sent back, Sri Lanka firmly on the backfoot now

he's even taking wickets off full tosses! The on-field umpires are going to check on its height before sending Tharanga on his way. And replays show the ball is dipping on it way below the waist when the batsman makes contact with a heave. Connects with the higher part of his bat and as a result it settles in nicely at Dhawan's hands at long-on. Outrageous. Watch the wicket here. (available in the subcontinent only, excluding Sri Lanka).

another one! Sri Lanka falling away. Good length outside off, Tharanga fishes at it, gets a thick outside edge and flies straight to a wide slip. That's terrific bowling. The old 1-2, the full, wide ball after the short one, gets just enough lateral movement too, the ball shaping away. Tharanga wafts and pays the price for a flirty, nothing stroke. Good captaincy from Kohli too, to have himself there.

what a comeback! The party is over and this is a beauty that has nipped him out. This one pitched at length on leg stump, deviated just a wee bit to square Tharanga up completely as he looked to play towards the on side, only managed a thin edge as Dhoni gobbled up that straightforward offering.

done him in. This was on the cards. Tharanga wasn't sure whether to slog sweep or pull, in the end he got into a tangle against this slider that came back in to crash into middle stump. You could sense this was coming, Hafeez worked him over superbly. If ever there was a case of someone deserved a wicket today, this was it.

he's holed out at deep square leg! He's played such a good innings, subduing his instincts, preparing himself for as long a haul as his team would need. But then on comes this tripe - a short ball, and it's sliding down leg too. How could he let such an offering go? So he pulls, and pulls hard, only for the top edge to result and sail right down the throat of Fakhar Zaman.

Usman strikes with his second ball on ODI debut. He storms through the defences of Tharanga and pegs the middle stump back. Bowled through the gate. This is an excellent delivery: full and skids back into the left hander. The speedgun reads 137ks but it looked quicker than that, beating Tharanga, who dared to play across the line. He does not make contact. Usman hits

bowled him, how good is this man! That skiddy, slippery pace, and it nips in from outside off stump, from the perfect length, and it's through the gate before Tharanga knows it. He was stuck on the crease, looking to whip that through midwicket, and next thing he knew was the sound of the stumps rattled. Great seam position - he's generating this movement because of how much backspin he puts on it.

Edged, and this time it carries to first slip, and Dhawan holds on, just about. Length ball close to off stump, Tharanga looks to drive on the up, and only manages a thick edge that goes to first slip at around thigh height. Spills out of Dhawan's hands first time, and he clutches on on the second attempt
short, some width, but does that stop on Tharanga? Throws his hands at it, but at the last moment he checks his shot, and ends up jabbing a catch at knee height to the man at cover

and he produces a stumping appeal. Kuldeep tosses it up on and around off stump. The ball breaks away from Tharanga's bat as he is lured into driving away from the body. And this is going to be so tight. The leggie has done its job superbly, dragging Tharanga forward just enough that his back foot might just be on the line as Dhoni breaks the stumps. And the third umpire rules it out. What a ball! What a strike! And what an innings! Tharanga has been floating on clouds today and it needed a jaffa to make him trip up.

and gone. Too many shots from Sri Lanka and they lose one. It's full outside off, he looks to flay a drive through the off side. Hard hands through the line, the ball lobs off the inside half to mid-on. A poor shot, it worked for a while but there were just too many, especially considering the start they had got

...and right after switching the angle to Tharanga, the batsman steps out for a lofted hit over mid-off. He is nowhere close to the pitch of the ball and winds up scooping a catch to Mahmudullah at mid-off

oh my, that's some terrible shot selection. Tries to cut from right in front of the stumps. It has cut in from a back of a length and come in so sharply that it almost took the glove. Inside edge and onto the stumps

gone next ball. Completely messes up the timing on his pull. He rolls his fingers over a shortish one and as a result the ball doesn't get up as much as Tharanga anticipated as well. Shoots past from underneath the bat and cuts in to hit the stumps. 50th ODI wicket for Mustafizur
